This is a debate that I keep having with someone at work. They keep telling me how DRM is evil because they're being forced to participate.
I can't help but laugh at such statements. I keep reminding him that he's never owned any of the movies or music that he thinks he owns.
I think this will be one of the biggest hurdles for the entertainment industry to face - convincing the average consumer of the truth that has been the truth all along.
I for one hope that Napster succeeds. I'm buying.
